    "in recent years , there are many works on self - similar automorphism groups of the rooted tree @xmath2 ( @xcite , @xcite , @xcite ) . the adding machine group is a typical example for self - similarity .",
    "we denote this group by @xmath3 .",
    "@xmath3 is a cyclic group generated by @xmath4where @xmath5 is an automorphism of the @xmath1ary rooted tree and @xmath6 is a permutation on @xmath7 .",
    "thus , @xmath3 is isomorphic to @xmath8 . on the other hand",
    ", one can consider the automorphism @xmath5 as adding one to a @xmath1adic integer .",
    "that is why the term adding machine is used ( @xcite ) . in @xcite ,",
    "@xmath1adic integers is pictured on a tree .",
    "this picture serves that any ultrametric space can be drawn on a tree .    in this paper",
    ", we equip @xmath0 with a natural metric and prove that the group of @xmath1adic integers is both isometric and isomorphic to the closure @xmath9 of the adding machine group , a subgroup of the automorphism group of the @xmath1ary rooted tree .",
    "first we recall basic definitions and notions .    _",
    "@xmath10 integers : _ a @xmath1adic integer is a formal series @xmath11 where each @xmath12 and the set of all @xmath1adic integers is denoted by @xmath13 .",
    "suppose that @xmath14 and @xmath15 be elements of @xmath13 .",
    "then @xmath5 addition with @xmath16 , @xmath17 , is determined for each @xmath18 by @xmath19 where @xmath20 .",
    "@xmath13 is a group under this operation and is called the group of @xmath1adic integers .",
    "let @xmath21 be an element of @xmath13 and @xmath22 .",
    "thus , there is a first index @xmath23 such that @xmath24 .",

    "the @xmath1adic value of @xmath5 is denoted by @xmath29 and @xmath30 for @xmath31 is a metric on @xmath32 ( for details see @xcite , @xcite and @xcite ) .    _ the automorphism group of the rooted tree : _ let @xmath33 be a finite set ( alphabet ) and let @xmath34be the set of all finite words .",
    "the length of a word @xmath35 is the number of its letters and is denoted by @xmath36 .",
    "the product of @xmath37 is naturally defined by concatenation @xmath38 .",
    "one can think of @xmath39 as vertex set of a rooted tree .",
    "[ tree ]    the set @xmath40 is called the @xmath41 level of @xmath39 .",
    "the empty word @xmath42 is the root of the tree @xmath39 .",
    "two words are connected by an edge if and only if they are of the form @xmath43 where @xmath44 and @xmath45 .",
    "a map @xmath46 is an endomorphism of the tree @xmath39 if it preserves the root and adjacency of the vertices .",
    "an automorphism is a bijective endomorphism .",
    "the group of all automorphisms of the tree @xmath39 is denoted by @xmath47 .    if @xmath48 is an automorphism group of the rooted tree @xmath39 then for @xmath44 , the subgroup @xmath49 is called the vertex stabilizer .",
    "the @xmath41 level stabilizer is the subgroup @xmath50 we need a useful way to express automorphisms of the rooted tree @xmath51 .",
    "for this aim , we give a definition and a proposition from @xcite .",
    "let @xmath52 be a group acting ( from the right ) by permutations on a set @xmath33 and let @xmath53 be an arbitrary group .",
    "then the ( permutational ) wreath product @xmath54 is the semi - direct product @xmath55 , where @xmath52 acts on the direct power @xmath56 by the respective permutations of the direct factors",
    ".    let @xmath57 .",
    "the multiplication rule for the elements @xmath58 is given by the formula @xmath59 where @xmath60 and @xmath61 is the image of @xmath62 under the action of @xmath63 .",
    "denote by @xmath64 the symmetric group of all permutations of @xmath33 .",
    "fix some indexing @xmath65 of @xmath33 .",
    "then we have an isomorphism @xmath66 given by @xmath67 where @xmath63 is the permutation equal to the action of @xmath68 on @xmath69    thus , @xmath70 is identified with the image @xmath71 and it is written as @xmath72    _ the adding machine group : _ let @xmath5 be the transformation on @xmath39 defined by the wreath recursion@xmath4where @xmath6 is an element of the symmetric group on @xmath7 .",
    "the transformation @xmath5 generates an infinite cyclic group on @xmath39 .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in this paper , we define a natural metric on @xmath0 and prove that the closure of the adding machine group , a subgroup of the automorphism group , is both isometric and isomorphic to the group of @xmath1adic integers . </S>",
    "<S> so , we show that the group of @xmath1adic integers can be isometrically embedded into the metric space @xmath0 . </S>"
  ]
}
